job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Rutland, VT
pros: Excellent Benefits and Pay package. Excellent Recognition programs
cons: Healthcare anywhere today is hard work and demanding. Not a lot of flexibility for days off. Short staffing in many areas

pros: Tuition reimbursement and opportunity to pick up overtime and extra hours
cons: Clique culture, really unfortunate to be like that. It could be a great place.

pros: Collaborative care Services and medical staff

review_title: Low employee morale, unethical, extremely poor management.
pros: Salary, benefits.  Looks good on the outside looking in but....Beware.
cons: Heavy workload, no communication! Low employee morale.  Most employees hate their jobs or their managers but have learned the hard way that our HR Dept has no power to do anything!  Afraid to rock any boats.  So depressing because they know they "have you" since there are no other decent paying jobs in Rutland. If you go to HR to complain or for help - forget about ever moving up or to a different dept!  Black listed.

pros:
Excellent Educational Benefits
Good Docs, especially Orthopedists
OK benefits
If you are part-time, you can have a decent schedule
cons:
Becoming very corporate
Small community hospital--- lots of drug and obesity related chronic patients
Management  constantly changing, but changes are superficial 
No help with vacation scheduling.  You must find your own coverage.

pros: Pleasant working environment, good benefits, plenty of parking, flexibility.
cons: Very demanding workload to the point where you don't have time to double check the accuracy of your work. they take advantage of tsalaried employees to the point of burnout.

pros: The benefits are great...most of the "lower-level" people are great.
cons: Management places a  huge emphasis on treating patients and co-workers well... constantly assessing employee engagement, contentment with working conditions, but end up treating staff poorly.  Since leaving, I have heard many former employees who have had very negative experiences, much like mine.  Training is inconsistent, as are expectations.

review_title: Good environment, good people - limited growth

pros: There are some really great, dedicated people working there.
cons: Some of the VPs have been there through their entire careers and have no outside experience.  They should hire competent, professional leadership teams at the top levels.
